title: The Mill on the Floss - Maggie's father disturbed

content.prompt: Why is Maggie's father disturbed by her "graces" (start of final paragraph)?

choices.label: A vindictive man, Mr. Tulliver begrudges his daughter's untroubled nature.
Surprised at Maggie's beauty, Mr. Tulliver is openly impatient with his wife's fussing over her.
Mr. Tulliver worries that his lack of means will limit Maggie's future opportunities.
Mr. Tulliver fears that his actual debts will be exposed when Maggie marries.

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the function of conflict in a text.
